author: VeganFoodIsYummy
body:
In 2011, Google wanted Nortel’s patents for 900M. But BB and others bought for $4.5B.

Google then bought out Motorola for $12.5B.

Fast forward to 2016, BB looked other way when WhatsApp infringed on its patents.

2018, BB sues FB (AND WINS!)

“I checked my patents to see how they are doing. The one about WhatsApp’s starred messages was still alive and well. It has been cited by 109 patents including those by IBM, HP and Palantir. It is somewhat comforting to know that when the tree fell in the forest, it didn’t get uprooted entirely. Its roots still nurture new ideas. Maybe some bragging rights remain…”

author: FlashyDisk1
body: Since the Motorola 68000 came out in 1979, Intel has always had an inferior ISA(instruction set architecture) but they just keep coming out ahead.  They even beat out all of the much faster RISC chips.  I wouldn't bet against them.

author: Chippopotanuse
body:
Volvo, BMW, Ford. 

But at the end of the day they are making hardware (cars). I don’t know that they will trade at big multiples for just making cars. I don’t think Tesla trades at huge multiples based solely on its auto business. 

It’s like investing in PC makers or cell phone makers. How is HP/Compaq/Dell/Motorola doing? Shitty probably. Or bankrupt. 

The real money is in the tech and ecosystem control. 

And what ecosystem is Ford trying to build? Or Volvo? They are still just trying to make cars as far as I know. 

But look to the tech giants:

 Facebook with its new Metaverse. 

Amazon with the cloud. 

Apple with its App Store and super tightly controlled iPad/iPhone universe. 

And Tesla with its vertically integrated solar/energy storage. 

Those things are super scalable and provide annuity streams of income. 

To the extent we get to truly autonomous cars, my guess is total auto production will drop through the floor. Why buy a car when you can rent one on demand?

And with work from home lowering overall commutes, it will only put more downward pressure on car ownership. 

Cars will be like cell phones in 20 years. They will be content delivery systems. With touch screens, AI, and self-driving capabilities. They will be consumer engagement devices and not just transportation.

That’s why Apple has been nibbling into autos. It fits right in to what they want - which is consumer engagement with their products for as long as possible each day so they can monetize as many interactions as possible.

author: bananaj0e
body: Motorola could have been extremely successful in the CPU market. Their CISC 68k line of CPUs were huge, used in the Apple Macintosh, Amiga, all sorts of embedded applications... but they eventually lost the market to Intel when they took too long to develop its RISC successor. They tried to come back with the PowerPC along with IBM and Apple, but Apple was the only consumer product manufacturer to use it.

Google owns their search engine, gmail, chrome, android, youtube, stadia, google play store, google cloud, google drive, google meets, hangouts, duo, google maps, google translate, google tv, google lens, google home, google pay, google finance, adsense, adwords, google fi, pixel, webpass, google photos, motorola, nest, fitbit, waze, doubleclick, looker, deepmind, and more..

Facebook owns their social media, their marketplace, messenger, whatsapp, instagram, oculus and not much more

author: zxc123zxc123
body:
>intel benchmarks

I love intel. I used their pentium processors as a kid. INTC is one of the first stocks that I bought as an investor. Held them since the early 2010's and added more over the years. But let's not joke. Anyone who knows anything knows that: 

#INTC benchmarks mean ABSOLUTELY NOTHING.

INTC always has and still puts out inaccurate or non comparable benchmark test. All of the chip makers do tests in environment, in scenarios, selecting tasks, and hooked up to optimal settings for themselves.  https://wccftech.com/intel-real-world-performance-misleading-benchmarks-intel-core-vs-amd-ryzen-cpus/

INTC isn't going back up until they catchup on the chip design, foundry, and manufacturing. Other chip designers are already finished with their 7/5nm and working on <5/3nm. 

Saying INTC 10nms are faster than competitors would be like Motorola saying the Razr is better than the Ipod in 2010. It means literally nothing because Iphone 3 had basically killed all the dumb-smart phones and Motorola will be bought up by google in a year.

author: tobesteve
body:
My Motorola has fingerprint on the power button. The power button is on the side, so it's thin and doesn't take any room on front of the phone. Samsung S9 that I had, had the fingerprint on the back, so I had to pick up the phone if it was laying. Anyway, it's nice to not have to pick up the phone, and to not have it take room in front. Do there are still improvements being made.

It's not worth a new phone purchase, but I got it as a promo and my old phone was starting to get issues.

author: whoareyouwhoisme
body:
history

1) When iphone started selling, they had sales much lower than the traditional Nokia, Motorola or blackberry. People were laughing at the pathetic sales compared to smartphone and traditional phones. Comments like “who wants to to swipe things, people want real keyboards”

2) Gas cars are not the future, whatever sales they have today will continue to get reduced because there is a big push from all those countries who want less pollution. So your going to see more claims from countries of by X year no more gas cars. Look at cigarette industry as a perfect example. Back then you can smoke anywhere and now you got to smoke in designated sections. Is anybody saying let’s invest into this giant cigarette industries..they will be gone as soon as marijuana continues to be legalized. It’s not a matter of will, it’s when.

3) anybody who doesn’t think autonomous driving isn’t our future…needs to group with the same people who said Apple iphone was doomed to fail. 

People who say Tesla is inflated doesn’t understand the multiple revenues it has enabled vs the traditional car companies. When people laughing about “Apple App Store”…..well between Google and Apple it enables $32 billion sales revenue just for Apps today and growing. If you understood Tesla multiple possible revenue streams (besides just selling cars and maintenance)…you can see they have multiple business programs that they declare that other car manufacturers can use. For example, maybe everyone may adopt Tesla own App system, autonomous driving in the future. 

The is only competitor who has this same strategy and they are not based in USA. Nio.. However NIO strategy is really copying how Apple did it with the iPhone.

Well you may say, Ford or Volvo or some other traditional car supplier can do the same.

Those traditional car companies are very good at building and maintaining their cars but do you think those car companies can build an ecosystem like how the Iphone turned the phone handset industry upside down? That is why the valuation of Tesla is so high and that is why players like Apple are looking into this industry. They want that eco-system, that’s the meat of the revenues (high margin profits).

Anyway…that’s my view.

author: Quirky-Suggestion865
body:
Well no, not really. I think that’s a very broad oversimplification. Like saying bicycles are basically boats because they can both carry people.  But let’s just say yes. 
The difference is that optical chips are currently very costly and labor intensive. Built one at a time, each requiring active alignment. POET can produce them at wafer scale, with existing  semiconductor foundry techniques. 100+- on each wafer meaning 1000’s per day. MSI would more likely end up being a customer( not saying they WILL be) rather than a competitor.

author: sockalicious
body:
The company is past its prime.  If Cramer hadn't pumped it a few months ago - while freely admitting he wasn't all that clear on what it does now that rappers and drug dealers don't use its core product anymore - no one on here would ever have heard of it, let alone bought calls.  

I mean, Ericsson, Nokia, Motorola Mobility, VoiceStream Wireless.  Qwest.  Global Crossing.  It's a time that's passed.
